page.title: 05EDUCATION - SULLINGTON
page.content: St. Joseph's Dominican Convent, The Abbey, Storrington, is a small Roman Catholic mixed boarding and day school for children aged three and a half years to eleven years. It was founded in 1953 by the Dominican Sisters in a Tudor building at the foot of the South Downs, formerly the home of the Ravenscroft family. Windlesham House School, Highden, Washington, is a mixed boarding school founded in 1837 in a Georgian building and has been under the control of the Malden family throughout its existence. The present Headmaster is the great-great-grandson of the founder. The school was formed into a Charitable Trust called the Malden Trust in 1963, and offers a wide range of activities for over three hundred pupils in mixed classes.
